text.section:
Evidence relating to a victim's reputation for chastity or abstinence and opinion evidence relating to a victim's chastity or abstinence may not be admitted in a prosecution for:
a crime specified under this subtitle or a lesser included crime;
the sexual abuse of a minor under § 3-602 of this title or a lesser included crime; or
the sexual abuse of a vulnerable adult under § 3-604 of this title or a lesser included crime.

section.section: Evidence described in subsection (a) or (b) of this section may not be referred to in a statement to a jury or introduced in a trial unless the court has first held a closed hearing and determined that the evidence is admissible.
The court may reconsider a ruling excluding the evidence and hold an additional closed hearing if new information is discovered during the course of the trial that may make the evidence admissible.
